title: What is the ideal liberation achieved through internal balance according to the Aurei Detti?
first_phrase: This text is a philosophical discussion regarding the concept of the "supreme intelligence" and its relation to other forms of intelligence. It features quotations and interpretations from various philosophers, including Cicero and Macrobius. In the last 200 tokens, the text becomes more esoteric, exploring the idea of transcendence from the physical body and the role of magic in achieving this. The text mentions Pythagoras, the Greek philosopher who believed in the transmigration of souls. Overall, the text delves into the nature of intelligence and the human experience of transcendence.

last_phrase: In conclusion, achieving the specific liberation of the soul from the body requires the stable attainment of inner balance, which can be prepared by the Aurei Detti. Without this, the pursuit of astral excursions entails significant risks, including the temptation of base abuse, hostile encounters with stronger astral beings, and unforeseeable physical harm. Developing a "subtle body" is also necessary for this, and its formation time varies depending on the individual's constitution and enthusiasm.
